channel.title: Project Unknown
channel.description:
Okay so recently i have started with experimenting with Socket.io and node.js my outcome was this.
[IMG]http://i57.tinypic.com/2h71mkn.png[/img]
I currently do not know where im going with this but i hope to make a MMO with this method let me know what you guys think?
Can node.js support Massive user bases?

item.title: Project Unknown
item.dc:creator: @JoshuaCoombs JoshuaCoombs
item.description:
@JoshuaCoombs wrote:

Very true , I made a lobby based system but I’m having a issue if the limit for the lobby is 6 players for some reason more people can join and then it crashes

Read full topic

item.title: Project Unknown
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“JoshuaCoombs, post:4, topic:541326”]Thank’s for your feedback guys im really interested in making a MMO with java

EDIT: Question for you guys, if i ran multiple node.js servers on the same computer but differnt ports can each of them act as seperate servers for for example:

127.0.0.1:8000 - USA server
127.0.0.1:8010 - UK server[/quote]Assuming you bind your application to each, sure. But usually different servers do mean different servers.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Unknown
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

justaguy:

[quote]Can node.js support Massive user bases?

The point of Node is to be a scalable solution in JavaScript for networking.[/quote]Yeah with games you might have to take some different approaches with modelling your server. Pomelo looked promising, but I haven’t used it myself.

Read full topic
